unit_learning_outcomes.description: develop and apply a research-informed knowledge and understanding of leadership in educational settings
critically reflect on recent developments in research, theory and practice of leadership for learning and their implications for diverse educational settings
demonstrate the ability to recognise and critically evaluate key theoretical paradigms for leadership
apply a range of relevant theories and constructs to the analysis of one’s own, and other people’s, experience of leadership and management in educational settings

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Engagement with OHTs and other resources

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to MEd or PGDipEdS or GradCertEdS or MEdLead or GradCertHEd or MEChild or GradCertEChild or MTeach(0-5) or GradCertClinEdSim or MIndigenousEd or GradDipIndigenousEd or GradDipChildLit or MChildLit or MPH or MSocEntre

assessments.assessment_title: Keynote paper and associated learning materials
assessments.description: Produce a resource for educational leaders comprising (a) critical review of leadership concepts relevant to a particular educational context  (b) associated keynote presentation materials. Word count 2500 words.
A Forum relating to one of the following areas: (a) effective leaders (b) transformational and distributed leadership (c) leadership and emotion. Word count 1250 words.

A Reflective Task relating to one of the following areas: (a) gender and leadership (b) leader impacts on student achievement (c) leadership and ethics (d) leadership and power. Word count 1250 words.

data.description: This unit focuses on the nature of leadership and what it means to lead for learning in a variety of educational contexts including early childhood, primary, secondary, adult and higher education. Participants: - explore and critique experience and existing knowledge and understanding of leadership in educational settings; - develop specialised knowledge of the broad theory and research relevant to the study and practice of educational leadership; - build a deeper understanding and appreciation of recent developments in research, theory and practice of leadership for learning through a process of individual and collaborative scholarship and critical reflection; - apply a range of relevant theories and constructs to the analysis of their own and others' experience of leadership and management in an educational setting, and; - develop capacity to lead for learning in multifaceted and changing educational organisations.
data.title: Leadership for Learning

description: This unit focuses on the nature of leadership and what it means to lead for learning in a variety of educational contexts including early childhood, primary, secondary, adult and higher education. Participants: - explore and critique experience and existing knowledge and understanding of leadership in educational settings; - develop specialised knowledge of the broad theory and research relevant to the study and practice of educational leadership; - build a deeper understanding and appreciation of recent developments in research, theory and practice of leadership for learning through a process of individual and collaborative scholarship and critical reflection; - apply a range of relevant theories and constructs to the analysis of their own and others' experience of leadership and management in an educational setting, and; - develop capacity to lead for learning in multifaceted and changing educational organisations.
title: Leadership for Learning
